title: Drawing, "Project number 1599 of the Fabrique de St. Ruf, for Gentleman's Embroidered Waistcoat", ca. 1785
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gouache on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper right: P. 1599; lower left: fragments of writing and blanc.
provenance: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1921: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Waving boughs and flowers decorate the pocket flap and lower left corner of waistcoat. Framing border with tiny boughs. Reverse: sketches of bowl in wreath and festoons and corner motif.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Project number 1599 of the Fabrique de St. Ruf, for Gentleman's Embroidered Waistcoat", ca. 1785.Pen and brown ink, brush and gouache on off-white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1921-22-241.
